result.execSummary:
The defendant Megan M Mcguffey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine, costs, & DNA surcharges within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Record Update - original filed in 15CM481

Defendant Megan M Mcguffey in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 15CM481 and 16CM121.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM481 Count 1: No Contest
16CM121: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15 CM481 Ct 1 and 16CM121.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 15CM481 count 2 is dismissed & read in.

ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler conurs with joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT:***
15CM481 Count 1: $10 fine + costs + DNA surcharge = $475  60 days to pay or set up payment plan.
Provide DNA Sample.

16CM121: $10 fine + costs + DNA surcharge = $465.00  60 days to pay or set up payment plan.
Plea/Sentencing Hearing set for 05/16/16 - return to sender, not deliverable as addressed, unable to forward
Plea/Sentencing Hearing set for 04/29/16 - return to sender, not deliverable as addressed, unable to forward
